clusters.title: UK shoppers warned over spread of harmful and illegal skin lightening kits
clusters.neutral_headline: UK shoppers warned over spread of harmful and illegal skin lightening kits
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian Health, BBC Health

items.title: UK shoppers warned over spread of harmful and illegal skin lightening kits
items.standfirst: Many products contain substances banned because of serious and sometimes irreversible health risks, says CTSIIllegal skin lightening products are being sold in an increasingly wide range of UK outlets, including butchers, specialist food shops and small grocery stores, trading standards officers have warned.The Chartered Trading Standards Institute (CTSI) is warning that many of the products contain substances that are banned because of the serious risks they pose to health, including skin damage, infections and pregnancy complications. Continue reading...
items.content: Many products contain substances banned because of serious and sometimes irreversible health risks, says CTSIIllegal skin lightening products are being sold in an increasingly wide range of UK outlets, including butchers, specialist food shops and small grocery stores, trading standards officers have warned.The Chartered Trading Standards Institute (CTSI) is warning that many of the products contain substances that are banned because of the serious risks they pose to health, including skin damage, infections and pregnancy complications. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Beef and lamb get 580 times more in EU subsidies than legumes, study finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Beef and lamb get 580 times more in EU subsidies than legumes, study finds

items.title: Beef and lamb get 580 times more in EU subsidies than legumes, study finds
items.standfirst: Report says common agricultural policy provides ‘unfair’ levels of support to unhealthy, meat-heavy dietsBeef and lamb receive 580 times more in EU subsidies than legumes, a report has found, despite scientists urging people to get more of their protein from less harmful sources.Analysis by the charity Foodrise found the EU’s common agricultural policy (CAP) provides “unfair” levels of support to meat-heavy diets that doctors consider unhealthy and climate scientists consider environmentally destructive. Continue reading...
items.content: Report says common agricultural policy provides ‘unfair’ levels of support to unhealthy, meat-heavy dietsBeef and lamb receive 580 times more in EU subsidies than legumes, a report has found, despite scientists urging people to get more of their protein from less harmful sources.Analysis by the charity Foodrise found the EU’s common agricultural policy (CAP) provides “unfair” levels of support to meat-heavy diets that doctors consider unhealthy and climate scientists consider environmentally destructive. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Psychedelics for depression, dart frog poison and why do we have chins? – podcast

items.title: Psychedelics for depression, dart frog poison and why do we have chins? – podcast
items.standfirst: Madeleine Finlay sits down with science editor Ian Sample and science correspondent Nicola Davis to discuss three eye-catching stories, including the impact of a powerful psychedelic on depression, answers on the death of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, and an explanation to the mystery of why humans have chinsSingle dose of potent psychedelic drug could help treat depression, trial showsWas Navalny poisoning by frog toxin meant to send a message? Continue reading...

clusters.title: The ‘guinea pigs’ who had face transplant surgery – podcast
clusters.neutral_headline: The ‘guinea pigs’ who had face transplant surgery – podcast

items.title: The ‘guinea pigs’ who had face transplant surgery – podcast
items.standfirst: Face transplant patient Robert Chelsea and writer Fay Bound Alberti talk through the promise – and darker side – of this pioneering surgeryIn 2019, Robert Chelsea made medical history, becoming the first black patient to ever have a full face transplant.He had previously suffered from a devastating car crash, leaving his face severely burnt. Once, he recalls to Annie Kelly, a little boy on the street shouted that he ‘looked like a zombie’. Continue reading...
items.content: Face transplant patient Robert Chelsea and writer Fay Bound Alberti talk through the promise – and darker side – of this pioneering surgeryIn 2019, Robert Chelsea made medical history, becoming the first black patient to ever have a full face transplant.He had previously suffered from a devastating car crash, leaving his face severely burnt. Once, he recalls to Annie Kelly, a little boy on the street shouted that he ‘looked like a zombie’. Continue reading...

clusters.title: NHS to spend more to settle lawsuits over negligence during childbirth after court ruling
clusters.neutral_headline: NHS to spend more to settle lawsuits over negligence...

items.title: NHS to spend more to settle lawsuits over negligence during childbirth after court ruling
items.standfirst: Supreme court rules children in England who suffer serious injuries at birth can claim for future lost earningsThe NHS will have to spend more money settling lawsuits involving negligence during childbirth after a supreme court ruling that lawyers said puts right a “historic injustice”.The court ruled on Wednesday that children in England who suffer catastrophic injuries while they are being born can claim damages for future earnings they would otherwise have had. Continue reading...
items.content: Supreme court rules children in England who suffer serious injuries at birth can claim for future lost earningsThe NHS will have to spend more money settling lawsuits involving negligence during childbirth after a supreme court ruling that lawyers said puts right a “historic injustice”.The court ruled on Wednesday that children in England who suffer catastrophic injuries while they are being born can claim damages for future earnings they would otherwise have had. Continue reading...

clusters.title: NHS hip and knee operations threatened by bone cement supply shortage
clusters.neutral_headline: NHS hip and knee operations threatened by bone cement supply shortage

items.title: NHS hip and knee operations threatened by bone cement supply shortage
items.standfirst: Campaigners say the news is a ‘crushing blow’ to patients waiting for surgeriesA shortage in medical cement could lead to delays in a number of patients getting hip and knee replacements and other planned surgeries, experts have said.There is a global supply issue from the NHS’s main provider of bone cement. As a result, hospitals have been ordered to ensure supplies are directed to trauma and urgent care. Continue reading...
items.content: Campaigners say the news is a ‘crushing blow’ to patients waiting for surgeriesA shortage in medical cement could lead to delays in a number of patients getting hip and knee replacements and other planned surgeries, experts have said.There is a global supply issue from the NHS’s main provider of bone cement. As a result, hospitals have been ordered to ensure supplies are directed to trauma and urgent care. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Environmental groups sue Trump’s EPA over repeal of landmark climate finding
clusters.neutral_headline: Environmental groups sue Trump’s EPA over repeal of landmark climate finding

items.title: Environmental groups sue Trump’s EPA over repeal of landmark climate finding
items.standfirst: Lawsuit from health and environmental justice groups challenges the EPA’s rollback of the ‘endangerment finding’More than a dozen health and environmental justice non-profits have sued the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) over its revocation of the legal determination that underpins US federal climate regulations.Filed in Washington DC circuit court, the lawsuit challenges the EPA’s rollback of the “endangerment finding”, which states that the buildup of heat-trapping pollution in the atmosphere endangers public health and welfare and has allowed the EPA to limit those emissions from vehicles, power plants and other industrial sources since 2009. The rollback was widely seen as a major setback to US efforts to combat the climate crisis. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawsuit from health and environmental justice groups challenges the EPA’s rollback of the ‘endangerment finding’More than a dozen health and environmental justice non-profits have sued the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) over its revocation of the legal determination that underpins US federal climate regulations.Filed in Washington DC circuit court, the lawsuit challenges the EPA’s rollback of the “endangerment finding”, which states that the buildup of heat-trapping pollution in the atmosphere endangers public health and welfare and has allowed the EPA to limit those emissions from vehicles, power plants and other industrial sources since 2009. The rollback was widely seen as a major setback to US efforts to combat the climate crisis. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Ketamine addiction making teenagers wet the bed, says UK’s first specialist clinic
clusters.neutral_headline: Ketamine addiction making teenagers wet the bed, says UK’s first specialist clinic

items.title: Ketamine addiction making teenagers wet the bed, says UK’s first specialist clinic
items.standfirst: Medics in Liverpool say intervention is needed to save children from ‘a miserable life’ of bladder problemsChildren are using incontinence pads and urinating in buckets next to their bed at night due to bladder problems caused by ketamine addiction, according to the first specialist NHS clinic dealing with the issue.Medics at Alder Hey children’s hospital in Liverpool have opened the first ketamine clinic for young people in the UK in response to a surge in urology problems linked to addiction of the drug. Continue reading...
items.content: Medics in Liverpool say intervention is needed to save children from ‘a miserable life’ of bladder problemsChildren are using incontinence pads and urinating in buckets next to their bed at night due to bladder problems caused by ketamine addiction, according to the first specialist NHS clinic dealing with the issue.Medics at Alder Hey children’s hospital in Liverpool have opened the first ketamine clinic for young people in the UK in response to a surge in urology problems linked to addiction of the drug. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Queen at Sea review – crushingly sad dementia drama offers a startling portrait of intimacy
clusters.neutral_headline: Queen at Sea review – crushingly sad dementia drama offers...

items.title: Queen at Sea review – crushingly sad dementia drama offers a startling portrait of intimacy
items.standfirst: Driven by fine performances from Tom Courtenay and Anna Calder-Marshall, Lance Hammer’s comeback is unbearable in its tragic candour and essential in its moral questioning This inexpressibly painful and sad story – featuring angry, complex, brilliant late-career performances from Tom Courtenay and Anna Calder-Marshall – is about dementia, the endgame of care and the decisions that need to be made when the spouse-carer is as vulnerable as the patient (and whose right it is to take those decisions). It is about the nature of intimacy between the two; and about the moment this becomes a problem for the grownup children with a conflicting sense of their own responsibilities.Queen at Sea is directed by indie US film-maker Lance Hammer, absent since his 2008 Sundance winner, Ballast. This is an almighty comeback, a lacerating movie bearing comparison with Michael Haneke’s Amour or Gaspar Noé’s Vortex. It concludes with a heartbreakingly ironic and enigmatic final sequence refusing the traditional final cadence; a diptych of love, contrasting the pleasures and expectations of intimacy across the generations. Continue reading...
items.content: Driven by fine performances from Tom Courtenay and Anna Calder-Marshall, Lance Hammer’s comeback is unbearable in its tragic candour and essential in its moral questioning This inexpressibly painful and sad story – featuring angry, complex, brilliant late-career performances from Tom Courtenay and Anna Calder-Marshall – is about dementia, the endgame of care and the decisions that need to be made when the spouse-carer is as vulnerable as the patient (and whose right it is to take those decisions). It is about the nature of intimacy between the two; and about the moment this becomes a problem for the grownup children with a conflicting sense of their own responsibilities.Queen at Sea is directed by indie US film-maker Lance Hammer, absent since his 2008 Sundance winner, Ballast. This is an almighty comeback, a lacerating movie bearing comparison with Michael Haneke’s Amour or Gaspar Noé’s Vortex. It concludes with a heartbreakingly ironic and enigmatic final sequence refusing the traditional final cadence; a diptych of love, contrasting the pleasures and expectations of intimacy across the generations. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Suicide rates for UK men are a ‘national catastrophe’, says Prince William
clusters.neutral_headline: Suicide rates for UK men are a ‘national catastrophe’, says Prince William

items.title: Suicide rates for UK men are a ‘national catastrophe’, says Prince William
items.standfirst: William tells radio panel that talking about emotions and mental health should become ‘second nature to us all’ Prince William has called the prevalence of male suicide in the UK a “national catastrophe” in a radio appearance in which he opened up about his approaches to dealing with difficult emotions.William told a special episode of Radio 1’s Life Hacks that “we need more male role models” to talk about their mental health publicly, to help other men do the same and make open discussions “second nature to us all”. Continue reading...
items.content: William tells radio panel that talking about emotions and mental health should become ‘second nature to us all’ Prince William has called the prevalence of male suicide in the UK a “national catastrophe” in a radio appearance in which he opened up about his approaches to dealing with difficult emotions.William told a special episode of Radio 1’s Life Hacks that “we need more male role models” to talk about their mental health publicly, to help other men do the same and make open discussions “second nature to us all”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Long Covid is still here. I know – my life came to a stop because of it
clusters.neutral_headline: Long Covid is still here. I know – my life came to a stop because of it

items.title: Long Covid is still here. I know – my life came to a stop because of it
items.standfirst: With more than 200 possible symptoms, long Covid isn’t easy to treat and diagnose. Rolled-back federal funding has led longhaulers to ask: is this all in my head?I am 30ft below the surface of the Blue Grotto, a crystalline diving hole in central Florida. Between the water’s embrace and the restriction of my wetsuit, my blood pressure finally stabilizes. The long, deep breaths I pull from my respirator keep my heart rate nice and low.I feel lighter than I have since April 2022, when I first contracted long Covid. I feel childlike at the fact that I can do this at all – get scuba certified – when on land I’m often confined to a wheelchair or a walker. Continue reading...
items.content: With more than 200 possible symptoms, long Covid isn’t easy to treat and diagnose. Rolled-back federal funding has led longhaulers to ask: is this all in my head?I am 30ft below the surface of the Blue Grotto, a crystalline diving hole in central Florida. Between the water’s embrace and the restriction of my wetsuit, my blood pressure finally stabilizes. The long, deep breaths I pull from my respirator keep my heart rate nice and low.I feel lighter than I have since April 2022, when I first contracted long Covid. I feel childlike at the fact that I can do this at all – get scuba certified – when on land I’m often confined to a wheelchair or a walker. Continue reading...

items.title: Campaign urges NHS to improve diagnosis of potentially life-threatening childbirth condition
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Five hospitals failed to spot Amisha Adhia had placenta accreta before one obstetrician intervenedAfter five hospitals failed to spot that she had a rare but potentially fatal complication of childbirth, Amisha Adhia is to launch a campaign urging the NHS to do more to diagnose the condition and save lives.Pregnant women are at much greater risk of developing placenta accreta spectrum if they have already given birth by caesarean section or had IVF treatment. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Hazardous substances found in all headphones tested by ToxFREE project

items.title: Hazardous substances found in all headphones tested by ToxFREE project
items.standfirst: Substances include chemicals that can cause cancer, neurodevelopmental problems and the feminisation of malesYou wear them at work, you wear them at play, you wear them to relax. You may even get sweaty in them at the gym.But an investigation into headphones has found every single pair tested contained substances hazardous to human health, including chemicals that can cause cancer, neurodevelopmental problems and the feminisation of males. Continue reading...
